p: Entry inhibitors: Inhibitors that bind directly to the viral E protein ( Schmidt et al., 2010, Schmidt et al., 2012) or those that can interfere with the steps in the viral and host membrane fusion can be used to effectively block viral entry. Similarly, peptide-based inhibitors that target the stem region of the E protein or therapeutic antibodies that bind to E domain III (DIII) or other parts of the E ectodomain can neutralize the virus in cell-based infections assays. mAbs against E protein domain III that potently neutralized dengue infection that are either serotype-specific or cross-reactive ( Beltramello et al., 2010).
